trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ItemInserting"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control raises the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView.ItemInserting> event when an Insert button (a button with its `CommandName` property set to "Insert") within the control is clicked, but before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control inserts the record.
This allows you to provide an event handler that performs a custom routine, such as HTML-encoding the values of a record before inserting it in the data source, whenever this event occurs.

A <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs> object is passed to the event handler, which allows you to determine the value of an optional command argument sent to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control and to indicate that the insert operation should be canceled.
To determine the value of the command argument, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property.
To cancel the insert operation, set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property to `true`.
You can also read or modify the field values for the new record by using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.Values%2A> property.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).

For a list of initial property values for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs> class, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs"></xref> class.
Use this constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs> class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs> class.
Property
Initial Value
The value of the `commandArgument` parameter.
This constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
An optional command argument passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
Gets the command argument for the insert operation passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property to determine the value of the command argument passed to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.CommandArgument%2A> property is used to carry extra information about insertion.
The command argument for the insert operation passed to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsView"></xref> control.
Gets a dictionary that contains the field name/value pairs for the record to insert.
Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.Values%2A> property to access the values of the fields for the record to insert.
For example, you can HTML-encode the values of the record before inserting it in the data source.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.DetailsViewInsertEventArgs.Values%2A> property returns an object that implements the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> interface.
The object contains <xref:System.Collections.DictionaryEntry> objects that represent the fields of the record.
As a shortcut, you can also use the indexer of the <xref:System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary> object to access the field values directly.
An <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.IOrderedDictionary"></xref> that contains a dictionary of key field name/value pairs for the record to insert.
